edu.byu.cs.superasteroids.content

Class ContentManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.byu.cs.superasteroids.content.ContentManager

  • public class ContentManager
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is used to load and unload files, such as images and sounds, into memory. It is also used to copy the asteroids.sqlite database file from the assets folder into the app's databases folder. This class is also used to manage the play back of audio files. Students need not worry about creating an instance of this class. A singleton instance of this class will be passed into all loadContent() functions called by the GameEngine or the ShipBuildingActivity. If a loadContent function is called, use this class's getInstance() function to get the singleton instance of this class.

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static ContentManager getInstance()
        Gets the singleton instance of this class. Instantiates the instance if it does not exist.
        Returns:
        The only instance of this class

      • getImageId

        public int getImageId(java.lang.String imagePath)
        Gets the ID of an image if it has already been loaded through this content manager
        Parameters:
        imagePath - The path of the image to get the ID for. The imagePath should use the assets folder as its base. EXAMPLE: A file located in the "assets/images/space.png" would have the path as "images/space.png".
        Returns:
        The ID associated with the imagePath if the image has been loaded. -1 if the image has not been loaded.

      • loadImage

        public int loadImage(java.lang.String imagePath)
        Loads an image into memory using the provided imagePath. If the image associated with the imagePath has already been loaded, the image is not reloaded and the image id is returned.
        Parameters:
        imagePath - The path of the image to load. The imagePath should use the assets folder as its base. EXAMPLE: A file located in the "assets/images/space.png" would have the path as "images/space.png".
        Returns:
        The ID of the image if the image was loaded, -1 otherwise. The image will not load if it does not exist in the assets folder or an assets subfolder or the path is incorrect.

      • loadImages

        public java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> loadImages(java.util.List<java.lang.String> imagePaths)
        Loads a list of images into memory.
        Parameters:
        imagePaths - A list of image paths associated with the desired images to load. Follow the image path guidelines in loadImage().
        Returns:
        A list of image IDs associated with the loaded images. NOTE: If any incorrect image paths are provided, the list will contain some image IDs == -1.

      • loadBitmap

        public android.graphics.Bitmap loadBitmap(int drawableId)
        Loads a drawable image into memory. Students shouldn't worry about using this function.
        Parameters:
        drawableId - The ID of the drawable image.
        Returns:
        The loaded bitmap of the drawable image.

      • unloadImage

        public boolean unloadImage(int imageId)
        Unloads an image from memory if the image exists in memory. If the image does not exist in memory, this function simply returns false as in indicator.
        Parameters:
        imageId - The ID of the image to unload from memory
        Returns:
        TRUE if the image associated with the provided ID was unloaded, FALSE otherwise

      • loadSound

        public int loadSound(java.lang.String filePath)
              throws java.io.IOException
        Loads a sound effect into memory. Background music files should be loaded with the loadLoopSound() function.
        Parameters:
        filePath - The path of the sound effect to load. The file path should use the assets folder as its base. EXAMPLE: A file located in the "assets/sounds/laser.ogg" would have the path as "sounds/laser.ogg".
        Returns:
        The ID of the loaded sound.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the sound file path was incorrect

      • unloadSound

        public void unloadSound(int id)
        Unloads a sound from memory.
        Parameters:
        id - The ID of the sound to unload.

      • loadLoopSound

        public int loadLoopSound(java.lang.String filePath)
                  throws java.io.IOException
        Loads a looping background sound file into memory. Sound effects should be loaded with the loadSound() function.
        Parameters:
        filePath - The file path of the background sound file to load. The file path should use the assets folder as its base. EXAMPLE: A file located in the "assets/sounds/laser.ogg" would have the path as "sounds/laser.ogg".
        Returns:
        The ID of the loop sound
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • unloadLoopSound

        public void unloadLoopSound(int id)
        Unloads a looping background sound file from memory. Sound effects should be unloaded with the unloadSound() function.
        Parameters:
        id - The ID of the loop sound to unload. If the ID is not associated with a loaded backgound sound file, nothing will be unloaded from memory.

      • playLoop

        public void playLoop(int id)
        Plays a looping background sound. If the sound was previously paused, the sound will pick up where it left off at the pause. Does nothing if there is no loaded background sound file associated with the provided ID.
        Parameters:
        id - The ID of the background sound to play.

      • pauseLoop

        public void pauseLoop(int id)
        Pauses a looping background sound. The audio framework will keep track of where in the playback it was paused. Does nothing if there is no loaded background sound file associated with the provided ID.
        Parameters:
        id - The ID of the background sound to pause.

      • resetLoop

        public void resetLoop(int id)
        Resets a looping background sound. This will set playback of the sound back to the beginning. Does nothing if there is no loaded background sound file associated with the provided ID.
        Parameters:
        id - The ID of the background sound to reset.

      • playSound

        public boolean playSound(int soundId,
                         float volume,
                         float speed)
        Plays a sound effect. Does nothing if there is no loaded sound effect associated with the provided ID.
        Parameters:
        soundId - The ID of the sound to play.
        volume - The volume of the sound. (range = 0.0 to 1.0)
        speed - Sound playback speed (1.0 = normal playback, range 0.5 - 2.0)
        Returns:
        TRUE if the sound was played, FALSE otherwise

      • setResources

        public void setResources(android.content.res.Resources resources)
        **Students need not worry about this function** Sets the Android app resources of this object
        Parameters:
        resources -

        public android.graphics.Bitmap getImage(int id)
        **Students need not worry about using this function** Gets a bitmap of a loaded image.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        The bitmap of the loaded image associated with the ID
